website_summaries.verdict: Great for beginning rock tumbling hobbyists, but even better for jewelers, metal detectors and ammunition reloaders.
pros: Very versatile, suitable for all levels of polishing and tumbling projects
cons: Noisy tumbler barrel, can fail unexpectedly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Got it all ready and turned it on. It ran about 10 minutes and the belt broke. We had to buy another belt right from the start. We got it running again and it kept going off track. It’s very loud so we put it outside on the porch with a crate over it. Every evening it’s doing fine, every morning it is standing still off track. Our rocks are getting tumbled, but probably not as well as they should be. Spend the money for a better one. This one won’t last long...not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L.

customer_reviews.title: Bone dry and needed oil
customer_reviews.text: This thing needs LOTS of oil on first use. It was noisy and overheated a lot shutting down completely until I realized it needed oil. I'm hoping that it has some sort of thermal overload to shut the motor off as it stopped turning until I unplugged it and let it cool down. After the big oil job it works much better and does not heat up near as much.
customer_reviews.author: Don Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sturdy.My daughter really liked it and enjoyed the whole process ! Here are some tips that will help you: Takes a very long time to do and results are mixed than what I expected. Softer rocks polish better. Find a nice quit place outside when you do this, like a garage. Use a little WD40 on rolling area to quiet it down. Do not spray on belt only rolling areas. If you do belt will slip.If not it squeaks and over heats. If you prolong polishing times make sure you place a fan on the motor in order to protect it from over heating.
customer_reviews.author: JW tucson

customer_reviews.title: ... polisher for some time now and it does a good job polishing rocks
customer_reviews.text: I have had this polisher for some time now and it does a good job polishing rocks. It is probably something I am not doing right but polish comes out a bit duller than I like. I am trying to run cycles longer and trying some different polishes. The tumbler itself is very simple design and is very sturdy. Motor heats a bit while running but does not get overly hot. Good running temp. Excellent entry level polisher for beginning rock enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette M. StoltzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for cleaning up jewelry.
customer_reviews.text: I make jewelry. I use PMC, a precious metal clay that bakes off the binding in a kiln and leaves .999 fine silver. When it comes out of the kiln it looks frosty light grey. After I throw it in the tumbler with stainless steel shot and water with dish soap, it comes out gleaming and shiny. Easy-peasy! Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty#9

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: The tumbler so far seems to work well, however, we are not quite done with our first set of rocks. Unfortunately, we had to order all the grit and polishers separate because unlike what is advertised when the box was delivered it contained the tumbler and that is it. We did not even receive instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its hard to put the lid on and then it comes off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my grandson for pressure cleaning my house. He did such a good job too. He got to the last stage of the rock tumbler grit, and looked at it two days in to see the progress of the polish. He put it back on the tumbler and the lid came off. He had luckily bought more grit with the purchase of this machine. After putting it on the tumbler it burst again. It burst four times in total. I don't know what he would do if he didn't buy extra grit for the rock tumbler. The seal on the lid won't stay closed.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: The Noise has an Added Benefit
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of them. It's AWESOME!!!! So much quieter than they used to make them. We put it in my daughter's room. The rumbling actually helps her sleep like a sort of white noise.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Fire

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year-old grandson and his father have made tumbling rocks a joint project. The results of the first batch were lovely, and they are making Christmas jewelry gifts. My grandson has a new appreciation for polished rocks and asked if the kitchen granite counters were tumbled before he thought about the size of the counters.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Patton

customer_reviews.title: Little Engine that CAN
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my 10 year-old daughter. We've just completed our first batch of rocks. Took about 3 weeks total. The machine was located in our shed, not in the house, so noise was not an issue. However, whenever we checked on it, it didn't seem very loud to me (as many people have commented here). The tumbler comes with a nice assortment of rocks to start off with. My daughter is HOOKED. Can't wait to tumble batch #2.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good tumbler
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Into the second week of tumbling and good results so far. No issues with the motor heating up or leaking materials. You will want to oil the rollers prior to starting your first batch of rocks.
customer_reviews.author: A Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but so cool!
customer_reviews.text: It was noisy but was so AWESOME to make our own smooth rocks. My kiddo loved it! It was hard to wait for the rocks to be finished.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I've read all these reviews, and take my word for it--here's the bottom line. It works perfectly. It is NOT too noisy, considering it's shuffling stones inside a tumbler. Put it in a room that you don't use all the time, and close the door. You won't hear a thing. As for the cover coming off--clearly operator error. It's a great little system, but that means that you have to follow the directions. This little motor is a thing to behold! AND, best part--it's MADE in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: BrilliantBuyer

customer_reviews.title: We had a lot of fun with this product with an 7-yr old boy
customer_reviews.text: We had a lot of fun with this product with an 7-yr old boy, interested in rocks. Set it up in the garage and any noise didn't bother us. Once we set it up, we didn't open it until the suggested times and probably should have, as the rocks ended up broken up more than we anticipated, running the full suggested time--without checking. They are lovely finished and we will use them to make some simple jewelry that my grandson will share with family members. Also took a lot of pictures of the process so that he can do a report to his second-grad class.
customer_reviews.author: Sally L. Jewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Tumbler for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great Tumbler for the money. It has been running non stop since Christmas when the kids got it. there is some wear happening but its holding up pretty well overall.
customer_reviews.author: D Kehl

customer_reviews.title: Fun hobby
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought a Rock Tumbler because he remembered doing this when he was a child. Rocks now tumble all the time. The machine is quiet, but if you have the tumbler in the same room, it also makes great white noise for sleeping. After showing our two boys, 23 and 25 years old, how the first rocks turned out, my husband ordered tumblers for each of them! It's a fun hobby that is inexpensive, and doesn't take tons of time.
customer_reviews.author: Karen T.

customer_reviews.title: disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Started to shed rubber right away. Didnt even make it through its second full tumble before the motor quit
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Like this product a lot.
customer_reviews.text: This is more expensive than the cheap, made-in-China ones. (I know - I bought one of them of few months back.) But this is vastly better than those other ones, and worth what you pay for it. The motor and rubber tumbler operate much more quietly. I had no problems with leakage. It holds more. I have my first set of rocks tumbling now, and have had it on for almost a week. The only problem I had was some wear on the tumbler edges, but as they smooth down, that goes away.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: After 4 uses with very light load the container would not spin. Threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to run in a waterproof container
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple of months now, and have had several problems. On my first batch of rocks, the lid kept popping off during the pre-polish stage, leaving a big mess. I cleaned it several times thoroughly before the lid was secure again. I would have contacted the supplier for support, but the only contact information I could find was a mailing address.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but noisy. I gave it a 4 star rating because the rubber barrel rubbed on the plastic guide wheel wearing the rubber barrel down a bit (the guides aren't aligned very well). After cleaning up the bits of rubber and lubricating the guides, I was able to quiet it down a bit. The 4 steps take 28 days to complete so keep that in mind when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Navarrette

customer_reviews.title: Love working with Thumler Staff!
customer_reviews.text: Company that makes is is AWESOME with support and help. The units worked great. Polishing left a bit to be desired, but I probably need to find a better fine grind. Fun documentation, and the full kit got my dad going right away (early-mid alzheimer's, but he had fun with it).
customer_reviews.author: pranamedic

customer_reviews.title: the reviews
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were mixed between good and bad. I bought this for my 5 year old daughter for Christmas. It ran great and never shut off/overheated. It did move itself across the counter. If you follow the instructions and oil it before you began the process then it is not that loud. I put it in the kitchen and honestly I miss the white noise it provided now that it is not running.
customer_reviews.author: Fancye Ginn

customer_reviews.title: Great tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is simplistic and effective. It holds about as many rocks as a pickle jar (but you shouldn't over-load it). It takes about 4 weeks (1 week per stage) to polish the rocks, as the grit gets finer and finer until they get a nice shine. My kids had fun with it, and now can collect rocks, excited to see what they will become.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Silent... once we oiled it
customer_reviews.text: So far we are enjoying our rock tumbler, we are 3 weeks into our first batch and after a week we were quite worried about the amount of noise coming from it. So I oiled the bushings (on the inside obviously) and it stopped all the noise. Now we couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Hoichan

customer_reviews.title: With a rubber Barrel it is not as noisy as a metal one
customer_reviews.text: Works but the tank leaks on it had to return it for replacement
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loved the gift but it doesn't hold up well and is really loud.
customer_reviews.author: Cowbelladams

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: The kids love tumbling rocks. This has been a good product. The only complaint is it has a tendency to drift to one side and then the barrel rubs against the side, shaving off small amounts of rubber. Not sure how to fix it, everytime I get it running straight, after a few minutes it drifts to one side again.
customer_reviews.author: P^2

customer_reviews.title: tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for my grandson. With adult help with directions, he is having a great time listening to his rocks tumble, reading about the tumbling process, and learning patience during the entire process. He already has plans on what to make with his beautiful rocks as gifts for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: KEL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for my needs. i have done three batches and am making jewelry with the finished stones.
customer_reviews.author: RedC

customer_reviews.title: Extremely noisy, but what would you expect?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, the results have thrilled both my rock gathering toddler, and my jewelry making wife. Be sure to find someplace out of the way and enclosed to put it, the noise is considerable, as is to be expected. Have experienced no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Paul Bellmore

customer_reviews.title: We like it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect it to take so long to tumble rocks, however not the machines fault. My own not knowing, however the machine itself is doing an awesome job, holds more than you think. I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This is OK, and maybe it's just me, but I just couldn't seem to get the results I was hoping for. It works as advertised but I was a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cade

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this tumbler no issues with it. We got it in 2016 and it’s still running strong👍
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: My son and I were so excited to try this. After reading a bunch of reviews we settled on this model. Less than a week into use, it exploded and left rocks, water/grime all over the floor. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: great little tumbler
customer_reviews.text: item is exactly as described. instructions were easy to understand and clear. tumbler operates exactly as its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: george white

customer_reviews.title: tumbler review
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the rock tumbler. I am new to the world of rock collecting and it would have been helpful to have more info with the product. like how much soap is needed to make stiff suds, how to attach the jewelry supplies that came with the tumbler.
customer_reviews.author: cyrus

customer_reviews.title: Used it several times now
customer_reviews.text: My son used this several times. it works way WAY better than some of the ones he had before. we are noticing some wear on the belt but it may be because it wasn't seated exactly right. It just sits on the top of the roller and belt. My son likes it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lickin’ and keeps on churning.
customer_reviews.text: Has run for nearly a year straight and it’s still going... The lid even popped off once and jammed it up for lord only knows how long! I cleaned it up, plugged it back in, and it just kept turning.
customer_reviews.author: JetCityPD

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described. A little noisier than we expected. I did have to lift one slide slightly in order to keep the tumbler in the middle of the rollers, and I oiled for some squeaking after the first week; but, overall, a great little machine that's still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: NormaB

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, fun for the kids and teaches patients
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Pataska

customer_reviews.title: This item was as described.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased that it was just as it was described. I had trouble finding a good one. It is for our 11 year old granddaughter and didn't want some plastic thing.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia D. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great size for us just getting started with rock tumbling.
customer_reviews.author: tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning brass.
customer_reviews.text: Its so easy to use and so quiet. My brass shells came out looking new after 2 hours of tumbling.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We just finished our first set. It worked really well. We're happy with it. It did squeek a bit after a few weeks, but we just oiled it according to the directions. Thanks :)
customer_reviews.author: A and P

customer_reviews.title: Smoooooth
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use .once we got going ,which was pretty easy .we were looking to polish any and every rock we could find.we ,as in my 5year old grandson.very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Keith Allen

customer_reviews.title: solid little machine
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to cover the "noise" of the machine. After owning this for 3 weeks. The machine is fairly quiet. Rocks rolling around are extremely loud. Since this is a rock polisher this is going to be consistent with all machines unless they have some crazy way of making the "jar" sound proof.
customer_reviews.author: M. gerlach

customer_reviews.title: good quality, except that the noise level far exceeded
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, good quality, except that the noise level far exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: SStill tumbling our first set of rocks; it seems to be working fine
customer_reviews.author: Christine J. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Quality made tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for my granddaughters, they love rocks. A family member in Michigan had this model and highly recommended it over other models. You get what you pay for in other words. So I hope both will really enjoy hours of tumbling their rocks into beautiful pieces.
customer_reviews.author: tmcginnis6902

customer_reviews.title: For patient kids
customer_reviews.text: By design, there's not a lot 'to do' with this activity while it simply spins and spins for weeks. But that's part of the learning experience; how to wait for the result. Got this for our 11year old after he'd been asking for one for about 3 years. He's very happy with it. As for the product, spend the extra to get this type of good one rather than the 'toy' versions. Even this one needs some adjustments over time. The rubber barrel really deadens the sound and is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in San Jose, CA

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: I own a small Jewelry store and needed a tumbler to clean the sterling silver..WoW..what a job it does in 15 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: BigT

customer_reviews.title: Just cool brings me back
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved it... the rocks were awesome- it takes a long time but well worth it... we tried a cheaper one from a discount retailer and it leaked and didn't work- this product was perfect.... we are planning on polishing more soon!
customer_reviews.author: S. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Rock tumbler
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely noisy. We put it in our garage while it was polishing nd tumbling the rocks. It did do a good job though
customer_reviews.author: Jeriann Childs

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was returned because the barrel started leaking after only running it for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Extremely quiet, beats the heck out of that old toy I had with a plastic barrel. This thing has a completely rubber barrel with a plastic cover that is put into the barrel itself ans sealed with a large rubber band on the outside. The barrel is simply massive for small to mid sized rocks and can make some nice sea glass in 2 days (yes, the rubber seems to handle it well). The only problem Ive had with it is that the cover is beginning to wear down, nothing a layer of hot glue didn't solve. For $80, its not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had a rock tumbler just like this but was used so was a little beat ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a rock tumbler just like this but was used so was a little beat up so thought get brand new but it leaks is there any good way not to have it leak
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My son has really enjoyed the process of polishing the stones and the quality that results from it.
customer_reviews.author: Angliski

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, have concerns about how long it will last.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, nice product. A little worried that the rollers are already starting to wear a bit. Noise is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McTee

customer_reviews.title: My First Polisher - Coins
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this product to polish stones, tho I might try it for that later. I was looking for a easier way to clean coins, found with a metal-detector. And this barrel approach works great, as with stones, a 3-stage process is used, the last stage being a dry one for final metal polishing. I'm still tweaking with sand and aquarium rock grades, to get the process down - this is a different type of learning fun, for this device. I'm glad I read other reviewer's notes out here.
customer_reviews.author: Walter R Bosma

customer_reviews.title: bt in georgia
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for our 9 year old for his birthday. he loves it! when we read the reviews on it the others said that it was noisy. we have found that it is not that bad, you can tell it is there at first but after awhile you dont even pay it any attention. this saturday we take out the finished product and i think i am just as excited as he is.
customer_reviews.author: B. Tennison

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far, but still learning to use it properly.
customer_reviews.author: John Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are pleased with the results of this rock tumbler
customer_reviews.author: luckybuck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this tumbler for polishing metal smithing projects once they are finished. It is the perfect size for small objects.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Savic polk

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Tumbler is sturdy and not loud at all. We have it in our basement beneath our bedroom and cannot hear it. So far we have completed the set of rocks that came with the tumbler and all turned out beautifully. This was purchased for a rock-loving 9 year-old. Huge hit at our home!
customer_reviews.author: kbmqu

customer_reviews.title: My wife likes polished rocks and it really makes me sad when she's disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For the 2nd to last cycle, a leak developed making a big mess. The opening is simply a plastic disc inside the the rim of the tube with a rubber ring providing tension from the outside. I tried contacting the company several times with no luck. My wife likes polished rocks and it really makes me sad when she's disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning user

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: A really nice tumbler, just wish it would polisher quicker.
customer_reviews.author: 4Gigi4

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: great product but beware it takes a month to actually get the rocks to process all the way
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: My first batch of rocks turned out great. I ran the unit in my basement, because it does make a lot of noise (hard to avoid). I ran it in front of a small fan to ensure that the motor stayed cool. I did have problems with the rubber getting rubbed off. I would find piles of rubber pieces when I went to change the cycle contents. I can't figure out where the rubber is rubbing off from, but it does NOT seem to affect how the machine works. I am satisfied over all. I am getting ready to run a second batch of rocks I collected at the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber ring was, is, difficult for my 76 year old hands to stretch to get on the lid, also when I checked it today it had stopped rolling, but fiddling with it a little got it going again.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Lasley

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed by this tumbler
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed by this tumbler....the tumbler kept opening while full of stone, water and sand....the patio got covered in white wet sand that we had to clean basically every day..... I would NOT recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gaucher

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted this for Christmas to make rocks smooth and shiny....this tumbler is quiet and shined the rocks perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend it for others to buy
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson has really been enjoying the transformation of the rocks. Nylon bearings must be oiled as per the directions in order to lessen the noise. Even so, we keep the tumbler in the garage. Would recommend it for others to buy.
customer_reviews.author: judy seilhamer

customer_reviews.title: Interesting but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew as an entry level rock tumbler. It worked well but was noisy enough to have to be banished to the garage when on. He has now graduated to a better one, but this is a great starter.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, stronger and more durable than others I have used. The rubber barrel also makes it quieter than any other model I have used. Overall great deal for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: turtlemania

customer_reviews.title: Great rock tumbler!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on cheaper tumblers, we chose this for our 8-year-old daughter. It really works! We put it in the basement and we were not bothered by the noise at all. After 4 weeks of tumbling using the different grades of polishing grit, my daughter was rewarded with beautiful, smooth "gems". She was delighted. The sample rocks provided were varied and interesting. We will be ordering more grit to make more.
customer_reviews.author: DebG

customer_reviews.title: Works great and kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first tumbler kit. The kids love it and are having a lot of fun watching their rocks change. I was pleasantly surprised that it was not as noisy as I had anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: JHP123

customer_reviews.title: go for the higher end unit
customer_reviews.text: concerns over the lid popping open and spilling the contents. go for the higher end unit with the bolt on lid.
customer_reviews.author: Loren N Hunt

customer_reviews.title: My grandson so enjoys it but is so noisy and ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandson so enjoys it but is so noisy and they live in a condo so we are trying to figure out something to put it in to make it a little quieter while working.
customer_reviews.author: James Bettinger

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hubby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for a Christmas present. He loves it and is looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and I like the way the drum seals. No leaks and silent running -- if you apply a little spray lube on the rollers periodically. Everything you need to run a batch is in the box... including raw stones. Downside: Does not have an on/off switch. I installed an in-line toggle switch about 10 inches from the unit for convenience. Manufacturers might entertain that ides. All round good unit!
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Burchett

customer_reviews.title: We would like to get a new barrel if possible but I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my grandson. His father just informed me that the rubber barrel is rubbing on the wheel and causing it to wear to the point that the o ring is nearly impossible to put on. We would like to get a new barrel if possible but I'm not sure how to go about doing that. If you could please tell me how to go about doing this I would appreciate it. Other than that it seems to be a great product. My grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dehnert

customer_reviews.title: Great home product for family
customer_reviews.text: I have always been interest in stone polishing having done it as a dad for my boys. This device was more sturdy and works well through the steps
customer_reviews.author: Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working great. Lots of fun with the kids each week.
customer_reviews.author: douglas j colwell jr

customer_reviews.title: no expert but
customer_reviews.text: it serves my purpose of just playing around with the grandchildren and seeing what happens to the stones we put in. Found out that the barrel must be completely dry on the outside when placing on the tumbler or it will not spin.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ogdahl

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it was not exactly wha t was looking for is way smaller than expected it to be
customer_reviews.author: debra mcelravy

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is no louder than the dishwasher, does not leak and produces lovely little rocks. A great family toy/activity.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rife

customer_reviews.title: not really a toy but it has made some great looking rocks
customer_reviews.text: works great I had a junky one before that made soooo much motor noise thank god it finally broke this one is great
customer_reviews.author: Diane Diane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have been thinking about getting a tumbler for a long time. Finally checked on the web and found the model T
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky noises after I started the 2nd cycle. Other ...
customer_reviews.text: Squeaky noises after I started the 2nd cycle. Other than that I hope it works out well. Cycle 1 showed a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: but he seems happy.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my grandson. I have not even seen the Tumbler, but he seems happy.
customer_reviews.author: Don Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The first one we got leaked. The second one came completely apart after 5 days and made a huge mess. I wrote the manufacture to find out what we could do different. They did not bother to respond. This is cute but it is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tumbler for my needs
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! This is the first rock tumbler I've ever had. Appears to be made well, runs quite for tumbling rocks in it with the rubber rock container. Not sure what electricity cost will be per load of rock tumbling since you have to run the tumbler 7 days for each of the 4 grit packs, medium, fine, pre-polish, and polish. Also, each grit pack set per tumbling session runs about $11 to $12. However, I think the polished rocks are going to look beautiful once done. Can't wait to see the finished results.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying our new rock tumbler. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: will sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old niece for Christmas and they finally got around to turning it on in March. Dad says it doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Milliken

customer_reviews.title: no complaints
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my friend who is OBSESSED with rocks... hunting, gathering, tumbling, admiring, etc. etc. so for someone who will use this quite often, it seems to work great. no complaints as of yet... we'll see if obsessive use will wear on the product. happy now though :)
customer_reviews.author: cmoe14121

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun for a hobby. Is Durable. Polishing rocks can get messy. Just keep it clean as much as possible and lubed and looks like it will last a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised, educational
customer_reviews.text: My son and daughter were interested in gems and rocks from a science encounter. They brought home their own raw rocks and we used this to smooth and polish them. So, it extended the science encounter, and now they have nice memories to keep on their desks. Yes, it takes patience, perhaps use that to explain geologic time scales :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: This Tumbler really rocks (pun intended).
customer_reviews.text: This Tumbler really rocks (pun intended). Just rolls on and on with no problems and great results. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Al the Father

customer_reviews.title: I think I got a bad unit, only worked for about a week
customer_reviews.text: I think I got a bad unit, only worked for about a week, than died. Returned it & built my own.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

product_meta.title: Thumler's Tumbler Rock Polisher
product_meta.description: At some point in time, we've all had a rock collection. Discover the hidden beauty of rocks and minerals with Thumler's Tumbler 3-Pound Single Barrel Rock/Stone Polishing Tumbler Home Machine. Convert rough and jagged rocks into polished stones in as little as 2 weeks with this heavy-duty home tumbler machine. Simple for anyone to use, including beginners, this machine turns a molded-rubber barrel round and round nonstop with rocks, water, and grit to create smooth and polished stones. This large 3-pound capacity barrel is the perfect size for tumbling stone, brass cartridges, castings, and more. Crafted from heavy-duty steel, this rock polisher is built to last. Whether a jewelry-maker or lapidary hobbyist, the Thumler's Tumbler Rock/Stone Polishing Tumbler Home Machine delivers high-quality, glistening stones in every use.
feature_bullets: SMOOTH AND POLISH ROCKS: Smooth and polish rocks and minerals with this heavy-duty large capacity home tumbler
MOLDED-RUBBER BARREL: Features a molded-rubber barrel to hold your rocks, water, and grit
LARGE 3-POUND CAPACITY: Molded-rubber barrel has large 3-pound capacity to fit large stones and rocks
INCLUDES EXTRAS: Includes 4 grades of polishing abrasives, jewelry findings, and booklet guide
HEAVY-DUTY MATERIALS: Crafted from heavy-duty steel for long-lasting, stable use
